author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, Adam Creighton and Kevin Nappoly of Enduring Games provide a high-level summary of low-level implementations and differences in development required to add the latest gaming platforms to concurrent development, with examples of in-development or just-released games. 

This session is designed for seasoned game teams making diverse content with UE5, to give considerations to help them avoid pitfalls and continually push the power of Unreal Engine to release more content for concurrent platforms, all with unified pipelines.

Topics covered include considerations for asset and graphics pipelines, render models, unique features in UE (and alternatives when not supported for the target platforms), and concurrent multiplatform development.

Find out more about using Unreal Engine to create games here: unrealengine.com/uses/games

#EnduringGames, #GameDevelopment, #GraphicsPipelines, #RenderModels, #MultiplatformDevelopment, #UnrealEngine
title: Low-Level Development Using UE and the Latest Gaming Platforms | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, we break down the key differences in workflows between Unity and Unreal Engine for those making the move to UE for mobile game development. 

Topics covered include mobile-specific features like touch inputs and device configurations, leveraging Blueprints, and exploring key metrics for performance optimization. 

We also peek under the hood to provide an understanding of how Unreal Engine is built.

Find out more about Unreal Engine for mobile game development here: unrealengine.com/uses/mobile-games

#MobileDevelopment, #Unity, #BlueprintVisualScripting, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestOrlando
title: Unity to Unreal Engine Transition: Workflows for Mobile Development | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, Universal Creative reveal how they generated feature-film-quality animation running in real time on the attraction 'Illumination’s Villain-Con Minion Blast', an interactive blaster game for all ages.

Explore the journey and challenges of converting film-quality characters to game-ready assets with zero quality loss, see the comparison of concept image and final rendered 3D scene, and enjoy a showcase of advanced environment lighting in Unreal Engine.

The team also outlines the successes and learnings of creating a real-time attraction on a moving walkway with up to 16 people in a room, the design of boss fights (including fighting engaging bosses in an infinite loop), and the graphics hardware used to achieve the amazing visuals using Unreal Engine on the attraction.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#UniversalCreative, #IlluminationsVillainConMinionBlast, #LocationBasedEntertainment, #Animation, #UnrealEngi
title: Bringing Illumination’s Villain-Con Minion Blast to Life With UE | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025
